GPUTexture.summary: The GPUTexture interface of the {{domxref("WebGPU API", "WebGPU API", "", "nocode")}} represents a container used to store 1D, 2D, or 3D arrays of data, such as images, to use in GPU rendering operations.

remarks.para: A GPUTexture object instance is created using the method.

GPUTextureCreateView.summary:
The createView() method of the
interface creates a representing a specific view of the GPUTexture.

GPUTextureDepthOrArrayLayers.summary:
The depthOrArrayLayers read-only property of the
interface represents the depth or layer count of the GPUTexture.

remarks.para: This is set based on the size property in the descriptor object passed into the originating call.

GPUTextureDepthOrArrayLayers.value: A number. This represents:In cases where the GPUTexture does not have a depth or layers, the value is 1.

GPUTextureDestroy.summary:
The destroy() method of the
interface destroys the GPUTexture.

GPUTextureDimension.summary:
The dimension read-only property of the
interface represents the dimension of the set of texels for each GPUTexture subresource.

remarks.para: This is set via the dimension property in the descriptor object passed into the originating call, which defaults to "2d" if omitted.

GPUTextureDimension.value: An enumerated value. Possible values are:

GPUTextureFormat.summary:
The format read-only property of the
interface represents the format of the GPUTexture.

remarks.para: This is set via the format property in the descriptor object passed into the originating call.

GPUTextureFormat.value: An enumerated value. See the Texture formats section of the specification for all the possible values.

GPUTextureHeight.summary:
The height read-only property of the
interface represents the height of the GPUTexture.

remarks.para: This is set based on the value of the size property in the descriptor object passed into the originating call.

GPUTextureLabel.summary:
The label property of the
interface provides a label that can be used to identify the object, for example in messages or console warnings.

remarks.para: This can be set by providing a label property in the descriptor object passed into the originating call, or you can get and set it directly on the GPUTexture object.

GPUTextureLabel.value: A string. If this has not been previously set as described above, it will be an empty string.

GPUTextureMipLevelCount.summary:
The mipLevelCount read-only property of the
interface represents the number of mip levels of the GPUTexture.

remarks.para: This is set via the mipLevelCount property in the descriptor object passed into the originating call. If omitted, this defaults to 1.

GPUTextureSampleCount.summary:
The sampleCount read-only property of the
interface represents the sample count of the GPUTexture.

remarks.para: This is set via the sampleCount property in the descriptor object passed into the originating call. If omitted, this defaults to 1.

GPUTextureUsage.summary:
The usage read-only property of the
interface is the {{glossary("bitwise flags")}} representing the allowed usages of the GPUTexture.

remarks.para: This is set via the usage property in the descriptor object passed into the originating call.

GPUTextureUsage.value:
The bitwise flags representing the original usages set when the GPUTexture was first created. The returned number is the sum of decimal values representing the different flags, as seen in the table below.
Usage flagUsage descriptionHex equiv.Decimal equiv.
GPUTextureUsage.COPY_SRCThe texture can be used as the source of a copy operation, for example the source argument of a call.0x011
GPUTextureUsage.COPY_DSTThe texture can be used as the destination of a copy/write operation, for example the destination argument of a call.0x022
GPUTextureUsage.RENDER_ATTACHMENTThe texture can be used as a color or depth/stencil attachment in a render pass, for example as the view property of the descriptor object in a call.0x1016
GPUTextureUsage.STORAGE_BINDINGThe texture can be bound for use as a storage texture in a shader, for example as a resource in a bind group entry when creating a (via ), which adheres to a entry with a specified storage texture binding layout.0x088
GPUTextureUsage.TEXTURE_BINDINGThe texture can be bound for use as a sampled texture in a shader, for example as a resource in a bind group entry when creating a (via ), which adheres to a entry with a specified texture binding layout.0x044

GPUTextureWidth.summary:
The width read-only property of the
interface represents the width of the GPUTexture.

remarks.para: This is set based on the value of the size property in the descriptor object passed into the originating call.
